answers.answer: My guess is they will watch you closer this time.  I had the same problem and did go on to have a second child.  I was on bedrest for most of it but made it to 36 weeks.  The first was 28 weeks.  So, it can happen again especially if you are with the same partner.  It is hard to just have one child.  You really do long for another child and want them to have a sibling.  I was told after it happened the second time to not have any more and I did not.  I did stay on blood pressure medication after the second baby.  A pill a day is worth every moment. I was much more careful and monitored much more the second time around so I did not get sick like the first time.  Goodluck in whatever you decide.

question: DecisionsI am a 40 year old mother of one, just found out I am pregnant with number 2 (unplanned).  I had severe pre-eclampsia with the first pregnancy.  Induced at 33 weeks.  Since then, I am 2 years older, heavier and still on anti-depression medication as a result of PPD after number one.  My kidneys are fine but I am borderline hypertensive.  I do want a second child but not at the risk of my health.  My husband is not thrilled with the idea of a second child mainly because he remembers all the scary stuff and my mama brain has blocked it out.Thoughts, comments?
title: 2nd pregnancy risks of preeclampsia
